boat.full_description:
Alberta is thought to be the first smack to be fitted with an engine. Built by Aldous of Brightlingsea, as a cutter-rigged oyster smack, her fishing number is CK318, registered in Colchester. She is listed on the National Historic Ships UK register, visit her website from the link above.

Visit Colm's photostream on Flickr for more photos of the East Coast Race, 2014.
boat.name: Alberta
boat.short_description: Alberta was built in 1885 by Aldous of Brightlingsea. Totally rebuilt at Barry Tester's yard at Hollowshore, 2002 - 2004, she is one of the fastest smacks sailing today.
